lom:description.lom:string: The California Aquatic Science Education Consortium (CASEC) is an assemblage of agencies, organizations, and citizen groups established for the purpose of encouraging, supporting, and enhancing aquatic (fresh and marine) education programs in the State of California. The Consortium's activities are shaped by the specific education objectives shared by all Consortium members: communication, coordination, cooperation, financial support, research, aquatic environmental issues, and advice. Besides general information about the group including information about membership, publications, newsletter, and calendar, the site also includes activities for children and adults.
